config.prompt: We are going to do a detailed build floor by floor of Castle Blood Forge. You are going to ensure consistency and dimensional alignment. The overview of each floor is below, I need you to start with the first floor of the castle at ground level. Only the first floor of the keep, see below. I have already decided a few things about this castle. Overall footprint Outer walls: about 1,040 ft (east‚Äìwest) by 840 ft (north‚Äìsouth). Enclosed area: roughly 874,000 sq ft, just over 20 acres inside the walls. This comfortably holds multiple large internal wings, courtyards, and yards. Curtain walls East wall: 1,040 ft long, 70 ft high (taller for sunrise shade). West wall: 1,040 ft long, 45 ft high (mountains already give shade). North wall: 840 ft long, 45 ft high. South wall: 840 ft long, 60 ft high (coastal, sun and siege facing). You can picture the walls forming a big, slightly elongated rectangle. Think of the inside divided loosely into three east‚Äìwest bands: north ward, central ward, south/industrial ward. Central keep base: about 300 ft (east‚Äìwest) by 360 ft (north‚Äìsouth). It sits roughly in the middle of the castle, leaving wide courtyards on all sides. So, let's just build the keep first. Central spire rises from its West Side, protruding about halfway from west wall of the keep,120+ ft tall. Vertical structure Ground level: Kitchen in the north eastern most corner about 60 ft north to south, and 100 ft east to west. There is a large cookware and tools closet in the kitchen, lots of counter space for food prep of a medieval era kitchen. Several hearths or various sizes are on the northern wall. The double doors to the root cellar are on the Western wall, these are just doors, not an entire space. A large door way to the south access a main hallway that runs the length of the of the keep east to west and is about 30 feet wide with large double doors at the east end. There is a spiral staircase in the hall, about the midpoint of the hallway and it is the south side of the hall way. Across from the kitchen is a grand banquet hall that is 250 ft north to south and 200 ft east to west.  First and second floors of the keep: have vampire feeding areas and lounges, noble and vampire apartments. You will need to fill in the rest of the footprint of the main keep with sensible spaces fitting to this gothic style vampire castle. Go with more granite stone with basalt and steel accents, Lots of jade and blood red colors, lavish and luxury are the tone, gothic style, art that looks interesting but when you look closely it is gruesome depictions.

accumulatedChunkResults.description: A grand, 30-foot wide hallway that spans the entire 300-foot length of the keep from east to west. Constructed of heavy, dark, polished granite and basalt, it is lit by a sinister crimson glow and serves as the main artery of the keep.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Keep Kitchen
accumulatedChunkResults.function: High-capacity medieval kitchen responsible for preparing food for all castle inhabitants and guests.
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: High-capacity medieval kitchen responsible for preparing food for all castle inhabitants and guests.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A bustling, functional kitchen occupying the northeast corner of the keep (100 ft E-W by 60 ft N-S). The northern wall is dominated by multiple large, soot-stained hearths. Despite the utilitarian function, the stone tiles are dark and the implements are often iron and copper.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Cookware and Tools Closet
accumulatedChunkResults.function: Storage for specialized and bulk kitchen equipment, including silver-plated service wear and heavy copper pots.
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Storage for specialized and bulk kitchen equipment, including silver-plated service wear and heavy copper pots.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A utilitarian, narrow closet adjacent to the Keep Kitchen, featuring shelves and hooks holding a vast array of cooking implements. It is dimly lit, metallic-smelling, and heavily cluttered.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Root Cellar Double Doors
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Provides direct, secured access from the Keep Kitchen down to the subterranean root cellar/storage level.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A small 10x10ft stone landing containing a set of heavy, reinforced wooden double doors, located on the western wall of the Keep Kitchen, leading down to the Root Cellar.
accumulatedChunkResults.function: Provides direct, secured access from the Keep Kitchen down to the subterranean root cellar/storage level.

accumulatedChunkResults.name: Communications Room
accumulatedChunkResults.purpose: Secure coordination and records room for traffic and courtyard activity.
accumulatedChunkResults.function: Secure coordination and records room for traffic and courtyard activity.
accumulatedChunkResults.description: A compact south-side room set adjacent to the South Great Hall and the western exterior wall, intended as a controlled overlook and verification point for messengers, guards, and stewards moving around the castle. Lady Erliza insists on precision and predictability; schedules, logs, and orders are treated like clockwork here. The space is quiet and disciplined: multiple stone writing desks for parallel record-keeping, benches for runners awaiting orders, wall-mounted shelving for ledgers in active rotation, and secured chests for sensitive documents. Windows on the south and west walls provide limited light and controlled sightlines. The room supports fast checks and discreet coordination rather than formal meetings‚Äîinformation control matters as much as Bloodsteel in this place.
